items.name: Ext.data.operation.Update
items.text:
Enacpsulates a update operation as performed by a {@link Ext.data.proxy.Proxy}.

This class is instantiated by {@link Ext.data.Store} and {@link Ext.data.Model} and should
not need to be instantiated in user code.

items.name: batch
items.text: The batch for this operation, if applicable

items.name: callback
items.text: Function to execute when operation completed.

items.name: records
items.text: Array of records.

items.name: operation
items.text: The Operation itself.

items.name: success
items.text: True when operation completed successfully.

items.name: id
items.text: The id of the operation.

items.name: internalCallback
items.text: A callback to run before the {@link #cfg!callback #callback}.

items.name: internalScope
items.text: Scope to run the {@link #cfg!internalCallback #internalCallback}

items.name: params
items.text: Parameters to pass along with the request when performing the operation.

items.name: proxy
items.text: The proxy for this operation

items.name: recordCreator
items.text: Passed to the reader, see {@link Ext.data.reader.Reader#method!read Ext.data.reader.Reader#read}

items.name: records
items.text:
The records associated with this operation. If this is a `read` operation, this will be
`{@link null}` until data is returned from the {@link Ext.data.proxy.Proxy}.

items.name: request
items.text: The request for this operation.

items.name: response
items.text: The response for this operation.

items.name: resultSet
items.text: The ResultSet for this operation.

items.name: scope
items.text: Scope for the {@link #cfg!callback #callback} function.

items.name: synchronous
items.text:
True if this Operation is to be executed synchronously. This property is inspected by a
{@link Ext.data.Batch} to see if a series of Operations can be executed in parallel or not.

items.name: url
items.text: The url for this operation. Typically this will be provided by a proxy and not configured here.

items.name: abort
items.text:
Aborts the processing of this operation on the {@link #cfg!proxy #proxy}.
This is only valid for proxies that make asynchronous requests.

items.name: addDeprecations
items.text:
This method applies a versioned, deprecation declaration to this class. This
is typically called by the `deprecated` config.

items.name: allowWrite
items.text: Checks whether this operation should cause writing to occur.
Whether the operation should cause a write to occur.

items.name: callParent
args
items.text:
The arguments, either an array or the `arguments` object
from the current method, for example: `this.callParent(arguments)`
Returns the result of calling the parent method

items.name: callSuper
args
items.text:
The arguments, either an array or the `arguments` object
from the current method, for example: `this.callSuper(arguments)`
Returns the result of calling the superclass method

items.name: constructor
items.text: Creates new Operation object.

items.name: config
items.text: (optional) Config object.

items.name: destroy
items.text:
This method is called to cleanup an object and its resources. After calling
this method, the object should not be used any further.

items.name: doProcess
items.text:
Process records in the operation after the response is successful and the result
set is parsed correctly. The base class implementation of this method is used by
"create" and "update" operations to allow the server response to update the client
side records.

items.name: resultSet
items.text: The result set

items.name: request
items.text: The request

items.name: response
items.text: The response

items.name: execute
items.text: Executes the operation on the configured {@link #cfg!proxy #proxy}.
The request object

items.name: getConfig
items.text:
Returns a specified config property value. If the name parameter is not passed,
all current configuration options will be returned as key value pairs.

items.name: name
items.text: The name of the config property to get.

items.name: peek
items.text: `true` to peek at the raw value without calling the getter.
The config property value.

items.name: getError
items.text: Returns the error string or object that was set using {@link #method!setException #setException}
The error object

items.name: getInitialConfig
name
items.text: Name of the config option to return.

The full config object or a single config value
when `name` parameter specified.

items.name: getRecords
items.text:
Returns the {@link Ext.data.Model}s associated with this operation. For read
operations the records as set by the {@link Ext.data.proxy.Proxy} will be
returned (returns `{@link null}` if the proxy has not yet set the records).

For create, update, and destroy operations the operation's initially configured
records will be returned, although the proxy may modify these records' data at some
point after the operation is initialized.

items.name: hasException
items.text: Returns true if this Operation encountered an exception (see also {@link #method!getError #getError})
True if there was an exception

items.name: hasOwnProperty
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

Returns true if object contains specified property; else
returns false.

items.name: initConfig

items.text: this

items.name: isComplete
items.text: Returns true if the Operation has been completed
True if the Operation is complete

items.name: isPrototypeOf
prototype
items.text:
an object to be tested against each link in the prototype chain of the
*object* argument

items.name: object
items.text: the object whose prototype chain will be searched
Returns true if object is a prototype and false if not.

items.name: isRunning
items.text: Returns true if the Operation has been started but has not yet completed.
True if the Operation is currently running

items.name: isStarted
items.text:
Returns true if the Operation has been started. Note that the Operation may have started AND completed, see
{@link #method!isRunning #isRunning} to test if the Operation is currently running.
True if the Operation has started

items.name: link
items.text:
Adds a "destroyable" object to an internal list of objects that will be destroyed
when this instance is destroyed (via `{@link #method!destroy #destroy}`).
The `value` passed.

items.name: propertyIsEnumerable
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

If the object does not have the specified property, this
method returns false.

items.name: setCompleted
items.text: Marks the Operation as completed.

items.name: setConfig
items.text: Sets a single/multiple configuration options.

items.name: name
items.text: The name of the property to set, or a set of key value pairs to set.

items.name: value
items.text: The value to set for the name parameter.
this

items.name: setException
items.text: Marks the Operation as having experienced an exception. Can be supplied with an option error message/object.

items.name: error
items.text: (optional) error string/object

items.name: setStarted
items.text: Marks the Operation as started.

items.name: setSuccessful
items.text: Marks the Operation as successful.

items.name: complete
items.text:
`true` to also mark this operation
as being complete See {@link #method!setCompleted #setCompleted}.

items.name: statics
toLocaleString
items.text:
Returns a string representing the object. This method is meant to be overridden by derived objects
for locale-specific purposes.

`{@link Object}`'s `{@link #method!toLocaleString toLocaleString}` returns the result of calling `{@link #method!toString toString}`.

This function is provided to give objects a generic `{@link #method!toLocaleString toLocaleString}` method, even though not all
may use it. Currently, only `{@link Array}`, `{@link Number}`, and `{@link Date}` override `{@link #method!toLocaleString toLocaleString}`.
Object represented as a string.

items.name: toString

items.text: Object represented as a string.

items.name: unlink
items.text:
Destroys a given set of `{@link #method!link #link}` objects. This is only needed if
the linked object is being destroyed before this instance.

items.name: names
items.text: The names of the linked objects to destroy.
this

items.name: valueOf
items.text:
Returns the primitive value of the specified object.

JavaScript calls the `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` method to convert an object to a primitive value. You rarely need to
invoke the `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` method yourself; JavaScript automatically invokes it when encountering an
object where a primitive value is expected.

By default, the `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` method is inherited by every object descended from `{@link Object}`. Every built-
in core object overrides this method to return an appropriate value. If an object has no primitive
value, `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` returns the object itself, which is displayed as:

    [object Object]

You can use `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` within your own code to convert a built-in object into a primitive value.
When you create a custom object, you can override `Object.valueOf` to call a custom method instead
of the default `{@link Object}` method.

You can create a function to be called in place of the default `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` method. Your function must
take no arguments.

Suppose you have an object type `myNumberType` and you want to create a `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` method for it.
The following code assigns a user-defined function to the object's valueOf method:

    myNumberType.prototype.valueOf = new Function(functionText)

With the preceding code in place, any time an object of type `myNumberType` is used in a context
where it is to be represented as a primitive value, JavaScript automatically calls the function
defined in the preceding code.

An object's `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` method is usually invoked by JavaScript, but you can invoke it yourself as
follows:

    myNumber.valueOf()

Note: Objects in string contexts convert via the `{@link #method!toString toString}` method, which is different from
`{@link String}` objects converting to string primitives using `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}`. All objects have a string
conversion, if only `"[object type]"`. But many objects do not convert to number, boolean, or
function.
Returns value of the object or the object itself.

items.name: wasSuccessful
items.text: Returns true if the Operation has completed and was successful
True if successful

items.name: $configPrefixed
items.text:
The value `true` causes `config` values to be stored on instances using a
property name prefixed with an underscore ("_") character. A value of `false`
stores `config` values as properties using their exact name (no prefix).

items.name: $configStrict
items.text:
The value `true` instructs the `{@link #method!initConfig initConfig}` method to only honor values for
properties declared in the `config` block of a class. When `false`, properties
that are not declared in a `config` block will be placed on the instance.

items.name: commit
items.text:
This private object is used to save on memory allocation. This instance is used to
apply server record updates as part of a record commit performed by calling the
set() method on the record. See doProcess.

items.name: complete
items.text: The completion status of this Operation. Use {@link #method!isComplete #isComplete}.

items.name: constructor
destroyed
items.text: This property is set to `true` after the `{@link #method!destroy destroy}` method is called.

items.name: error
items.text: The error object passed when {@link #method!setException #setException} was called. This could be any object or primitive.

items.name: exception
items.text: The exception status of this Operation. Use {@link #method!hasException #hasException} and see {@link #method!getError #getError}.

items.name: foreignKeyDirection
items.text:
This number is used by `{@link Ext.data.Batch#method!sort Ext.data.Batch#sort}` to order operations of the
same type. This value is multipled by the "entity rank" (which is determined by
foreign-key dependencies) to invert the direction of the sort based on the type of
operation. Only `{@link Ext.data.operation.Destroy}` overrides this value.

items.name: isConfiguring
items.text: This property is set to `true` during the call to `{@link #method!initConfig initConfig}`.

items.name: isFirstInstance
items.text: This property is set to `true` if this instance is the first of its class.

items.name: isInstance
items.text:
This value is `true` and is used to identify plain objects from instances of
a defined class.

items.name: order
items.text:
This number is used by `{@link Ext.data.Batch#method!sort Ext.data.Batch#sort}` to order operations. Order of
operations of the same type is determined by foreign-key dependencies. The array of
operations is sorted by ascending (increasing) values of `{@link #property!order order}`.

items.name: prototype
items.text: Allows the addition of properties to all objects of type Object.

items.name: running
items.text: The run status of this Operation. Use {@link #method!isRunning #isRunning}.

items.name: self
started
items.text: The start status of this Operation. Use {@link #method!isStarted #isStarted}.

items.name: success
items.text:
Whether the Operation was successful or not. This starts as undefined and is set to true
or false by the Proxy that is executing the Operation. It is also set to false by {@link #method!setException #setException}. Use
{@link #method!wasSuccessful #wasSuccessful} to query success status.

items.name: addConfig
items.text:
Adds new config properties to this class. This is called for classes when they
are declared, then for any mixins that class may define and finally for any
overrides defined that target the class.

items.name: mixinClass
items.text: The mixin class if the configs are from a mixin.

items.name: addMembers
members
items.text: The members to add to this class.

items.name: isStatic
items.text: Pass `true` if the members are static.

items.name: privacy
items.text:
Pass `true` if the members are private. This
only has meaning in debug mode and only for methods.

items.name: addStatics

items.text: this

items.name: borrow
fromClass
items.text: The class to borrow members from

items.name: members
items.text: The names of the members to borrow
this

items.name: create

items.text: the created instance.

items.name: createAlias
alias
items.text:
The new method name, or an object to set multiple aliases. See
{@link Ext.Function#method!flexSetter Ext.Function#flexSetter}

items.name: origin
items.text: The original method name

items.name: getConfigurator
items.text: Returns the `{@link Ext.Configurator}` for this class.

items.name: getName

items.text: className

items.name: mixin
items.text: Used internally by the mixins pre-processor

items.name: override
members
items.text:
The properties to add to this class. This should be
specified as an object literal containing one or more properties.
this class
